title: Paul Kent (journalist)
text:
Paul Kent is an <a href="Australian">Australian</a> journalist and former <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer. 
In 1989 he played in one first grade match for the <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta Eels</a> at halfback, becoming the 481st player for the club.
He also commentates boxing 
Since retiring, he has become a journalist and now works for "<a href="The%20Daily%20Telegraph%20%28Sydney%29">The Daily Telegraph</a>" and is currently co-host of <a href="NRL%20360">NRL 360</a> on <a href="Fox%20Sports%20%28Australia%29">Fox Sports</a> alongside journalist Yvonne Sampson.
He has written two books; "Sonny Ball" and "Johnny Lewis: The Biography" — about <a href="Sonny%20Bill%20Williams">Sonny Bill Williams</a> and <a href="Johnny%20Lewis%20%28boxing%20trainer%29">Johnny Lewis</a>, respectively. "Sonny Ball" was chosen as one of the best sports books of 2015 by Australian newspaper "The New Daily". Kent is a weekly panel member for Triple M's Sunday NRL Show. 
Paul Kent's opinions of <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne Storm</a> coach, <a href="Craig%20Bellamy%20%28rugby%20league%29">Craig Bellamy</a>, brought forth a response from the coach who claimed the accusations were disrespectful and out of line.
